qas.question: What was London's estimated population in the 1980s?
What event preceded a substantial decrease in the average population in London?
The main ports for London were relocated to where?
When was construction on the Thames Barrier completed?
What was the primary function of the Thames Barrier?

answers.text: to protect London against tidal surges from the North Sea

context: Greater London's population declined steadily in the decades after <a1_0>the Second World War<a1_0/>, from an estimated peak of 8.6 million in 1939 to <a0_0>around 6.8 million<a0_0/> in the 1980s. The principal ports for London moved downstream to <a2_0>Felixstowe and Tilbury<a2_0/>, with the London Docklands area becoming a focus for regeneration, including the Canary Wharf development. This was borne out of London's ever-increasing role as a major international financial centre during the 1980s. The Thames Barrier was completed in <a3_0>the 1980s<a3_0/> <a4_0>to protect London against tidal surges from the North Sea<a4_0/>.
